intro: Cheiridopsis glomerata, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form. The plant features dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and grayish-green, adapted to store water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
